dublin_core.dcvalue: Improving the health of women and children is a global health imperative reflected in two of the most compelling Millennium Development Goals which seek specifically to reduce maternal and infant deaths by 2015 This joint report by the World Health Organization WHO and the International Telecommunication Union ITU based on a 64 country survey demonstrates as never before in such detail the vital role that information and communication technologies ICTs and particularly eHealth are playing today in helping achieve those targets It demonstrates how every day eHealth is saving the lives of women their babies and infants in the some of the most vulnerable populations around the world in a wide variety of innovative ways
